newsitem.title: GERMANY: German wholesale sales edge up in February.
newsitem.headline: German wholesale sales edge up in February.

text.p: German wholesale sales edged up in February by a real and seasonally-adjusted 0.1 percent, but were still down by a real 0.6 percent on a year earlier, the Federal Statistics Office said on Tuesday.

The modest gain followed a downward revision to January's wholesale sales numbers, which still showed a monthly gain -- again real and seasonally adjusted -- of 1.6 percent. The real rise year-on-year in January was 2.4 percent.
In nominal terms, wholesale sales were unchanged from January to February, but were up 0.9 percent against a year earlier.

A breakdown of the figures showed that there had been strong gains in sales of raw materials, half-finished goods and old materials, which were up seven percent in real terms. Sales of machinery and equipment were also up a real seven percent.
Wholesale sales of food, drinks and tobacco were down seven percent, and consumer goods and durables were down six percent.
For the first two months of this year, wholesale sales were up a real one percent and up two percent in nominal terms.
